result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF114, 22TR486 & 22TR487 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen   DF:  Tim Joseph Mularie did not appear. Case called at 9:29 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference with a jury trial scheduled. DE does not appear. Currently in custody in Washington County Jail. Zoom hearing was attempted but was not approved by Washington County. ADA Smestad states DE may be in custody past the trial date. Does not know release date at this time. Requesting a possible warrant be issued. Atty Petersen makes argument. Court will issue bench warrant, extraditable adjoining states. Jury trial date will be removed. DE made a speedy trial demand but due to out of state custody status, more difficult to facilitate. If DE returns to this jurisdiction, he may invoke rights to speedy trial demand. TR matters will be scheduled for a review in 60 days. Court adjourned at 9:36 a.m.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Melissa M. Petersen appears via zoom   DF:  Tim Joseph Mularie appeared from jail. Case called at 10:32 a.m. Court asked for this matter set for a hearing after receiving letter from ADA Smestad requesting a continuance. Notes a speedy trial demand was made and also DE posted bond and is still in custody. Deputy states DE has an active warrant in Washington County. Trying to get clarification from Washington County. ADA Ellenwood did follow up with the State Lab and we are still in the 3rd or 4th position. Atty Petersen gives argument. Court will grant the State's request for a continuance. Notes speedy trial demand was made but DE has posted bond and is not being held on this file. Refers parties to schedule with JA. Since a speedy trial demand, be scheduled sooner than later. Address and phone confirmed. Atty Petersen requesting DE contact her once he is out of custody. Court will keep the April date on the calendar as a status.
Motion hearing on April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
